summary:
Here is a summary of the document in 3-5 sentences, focusing on the main topic and key concepts:

H.P. Lovecraft's later stories, particularly those written after 1928, integrated elements from his earlier tales, such as the Deep Ones, Arkham, and the Necronomicon. This integration was influenced by his younger correspondents, including Robert Bloch and Frank Belknap Long, who contributed to the development of the Cthulhu Mythos. August Derleth, a close friend and collaborator of Lovecraft, continued to write and expand on the Cthulhu Mythos after Lovecraft's death, introducing new characters and elements, such as the Tcho-Tcho people and the sand-dwellers. Derleth's efforts helped to keep Lovecraft's works in print and available to the public, ensuring the continuation of the Cthulhu Mythos.

qa_pairs.question: When did Lovecraft begin to integrate some of his earliest creations into his later stories?
qa_pairs.answer: probably only at the urging of some of his younger correspondents, late in his career

qa_pairs.question: In which story did Lovecraft reintroduce the creature Dagon?
In which story did Lovecraft first use the fictional city of Arkham?
qa_pairs.answer: in the story 'The Picture in the House' (1920)

qa_pairs.question: In what story did Lovecraft first develop the fictional city of Arkham and its Miskatonic University?
In what stories did Lovecraft describe the different alien beings that had visited and colonized pre-human Earth?
qa_pairs.answer: in 'The Mountains of Madness' (1931) and 'The Shadow Out of Time' (1934-1935)

qa_pairs.question: What was the name of the fungus from Yuggoth that was mentioned in Lovecraft's later stories?
What is the setting for Lovecraft's stories 'The Mountains of Madness' and 'The Shadow Out of Time'?
What is the title of Lovecraft's famous creation that undergoes a gradual evolution?
Who is the author of the story 'The People of the Monolith'?
What is the title of a story written by Howard that is referenced in Lovecraft's works?
What are some examples of alien beings described in 'The Mountains of Madness' and 'The Shadow Out of Time'?
qa_pairs.answer: fungal beings from Yuggoth and the Cthulhu spawn

qa_pairs.question: Who is the author of 'The People of the Monolith'?
Who is referred to as the Master of American Horror?
Who is the author of the terrible book 'People of the Monolith'?
Who provided the blasphemous books 'De Vermiis Mysteriis' and 'the Cultes des Goules'?
In what year did Robert Bloch write the story 'Shambler from the Stars'?
Who dispatched protagonist Robert Blake in the 'The Haunter of the Dark'?
Who brought the hounds of Tindalos and Chaugnar Faugn to the collection?
What authors incorporated elements from Lovecraft's stories into their own works?
qa_pairs.answer: Robert Bloch and Frank Belknap Long

qa_pairs.question: What is the name of the fictional town that served as the basis for many of Lovecraft's stories?
Who added the most to the collection of Great Old Ones and alien races?
What is the name of the fictional town that was the basis for the story 'The Horror in the Hills'?
Who wrote the story 'The Haunter of the Dark'?
When did Lovecraft die?
